Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Endoscopic Pedicle Saphenous Vein Graft Harvesting in Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting

Participants.evidence: Participants were patients undergoing coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG) with SVGs. Eligibility criteria included patients without severe diabetes, age <80, and no multivessel bypass requirement.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group underwent Pedicle-EVH, while the control group received conventional NT-SVG harvesting.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy of endoscopic pedicle SVG harvesting (Pedicle-EVH) in reducing wound complications while maintaining patency.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was early graft patency, assessed via coronary computed tomographic angiography (CCTA) before hospital discharge.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 148 patients were randomised: 72 to Pedicle-EVH and 76 to NT-SVG.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Early patency was 95.8% in the Pedicle-EVH group.

Harms.evidence: No major wound complications were reported. Lymphorrhea occurred in 2/72 (2.8%) Pedicle-EVH patients.

Funding.evidence: Funding: No conflicts of interest declared.
